comm: yorker first up to Gunathilaka. On middle and leg, nicely tickled fine towards fine leg, Hazlewood sloppily fumbles to allow the second
nice comeback. Fullish and wide outside of at 138 kph, not much swing. Gunathilaka leaves
good run that. Pushed towards mid-on with soft hands and sets off, makes the run with ease
beauty. Good length on off, zoning in on that off bail but Dilshan gets some bat on it, a thick outside edge towards third man
poor delivery. Drifts on leg and Gunathilaka picks him off with ease towards square leg for a couple. Not swing at all for Starc so far

bowled. There is Starc's customary first-over wicket. What a delivery again. Fuller than a good length - the ideal length. Gunathilaka is neither forward nor back, so he tentatively pokes at the length. Since there is no swing, the ball carries on towards the inside edge, kisses that edge and rattles into middle stump. Beaten by the length actually of that
ooh, full and wide outside off, 129 kph but plenty of swing. Dilshan flays at that but misses altogether. Lovely delivery
nicely bowled, full outside off - sixth-stump line. Dilshan is more respectful this time as he pushes towards mid-off
awkwardly played back. Full on off, the ball moves away late. Dilshan wants to pick a gap through the leg side but there is some away swing. Bunted back to the bowler
poor delivery. 136 kph, down leg. Easy pickings for Dilshan, but he misses his flick. Clips his pad on the way to the fine leg boundary
better riposte. Fullish on off, no swing this time. Nudged towards square leg
another thick outside edge from Dilshan. Nice channel around off, one to third man
141 kph, strays down leg. Building up impressive pace. Dilshan misses a whip, but the ball takes the pad. The keeper collects
superb shot. Overpitched outside off from Starc, Dilshan strides forward and pushes his straight drive through mid-off. Full face of the bat
four more! Not a bad delivery but Dilshan shuffles across and drags his flick from outside off to the square leg boundary. It was shaped away too.
quite full outside off again, driven but finds mid-off this time
146 kph, pacey stuff. Full and wide outside off, a Test-match tempter. Dilshan throws his hands at that but hits his drive to cover. Still no swing, despite the wind.
148 kph, getting quicker and quicker. Good length on middle and leg, a bit of extra bounce helps the ball rap Dilshan on the gloves as he tries to nudge into the leg side
oh what a shot. Superb. Class all over. Full delivery on off, a half-volley but Mendis opened his wrists very late to find the gap through cover. Lovely timing too

got 'im this time. A superb comeback from Hazlewood. Drags his length back this time, close to off. Mendis has to defend, and although the ball doesn't move, it still takes Mendis' outside edge. Carries low to Warner at second slip who dives in front and completes a quality catch. SL in some trouble
good length, swerving back in. Nudged towards square leg
good stuff. Brings the ball back in from a good length outside off. Quelled towards square leg for one.
overpitched and smashed. Superb batting, counter-attacking. Straight this time and Dilshan times his on-drive well. Beats the diving mid-on fielder.
good leave. Back of a length outside off, Dilshan thinks of playing but withdraws. Extra bounce. He shadow practices the punch

nice stuff from Starc. Pace in a lovely channel. Good length, just outside off - more towards fifth stump. Chandimal bails out of his leave too late, finds first slip on the bounce off that withdrawing bat
good length and close to off, properly behind the line of that to block
shot! On top of the bounce, makes sure he keeps it down and nails his square cut through point. Another sublime shot
lovely. Moves this away from Chandimal who has to waft, the away movement takes the ball past the outside edge. Lovely bowling
another superb stroke and that will be four more. Overpitched on off, Chandimal doesn't plant his front foot forward, instead just pushes his straight drive past mid-off. All timing
a bit wide outside off, Chandimal slashes his cut down to third man
runs leaking. Too straight this time and Chandimal whips his flick through midwicket. Another superb shot from Chandmial. Immense power in those wrists
overpitched outside off, calmly driven towards mid-off
strays down leg this time, clipped to deep square leg
good length on off, bunted out towards cover. Loud yelp of "nooo" from Chandi
back of a length and swinging back in. Dilshan inside edges one into his boot
back of a length outside off, some extra bounce. Dilshan flays but misses
full and wide outside off gentle loosener, 126 kph. Chandimal is happy to leave those
fullish outside off, brings that line closer to off. Pushed into the off side
full and wide outside off, Chandimal comes forward and blocks into the off side
good length outside off, the ball swerving back in. Bat and pad together, a solid block ensues
lovely lines these. Just around off, Chandimal comes forward to try and get one to square leg but can't, finds midwicket
good length outside off, tapped into the off side. Maiden from Hastings, good stuff
135 kph, ouch! Back of a length delivery on middle and off, Dilshan is early through his pull and wears the blow, near his ribs. Goes through with the run
good length on middle and leg, worked away towards midwicket
oh yes, shot! Overpitched on off, Chandimal nails his on-drive. Presents the full face of the bat, timing exquisite. Signs of a nice, batting surface
back of a length delivery outside off, tapped down towards third man for a run
good length delivery outside off, 132 kph. Dilshan leaves.
back of a length on off, Dilshan rides the bounce nicely and works towards square leg
133 kph, quite wide outside off. Dilshan stretches out but leaves
overpitched on off, Dilshan tries to beat the ball but mis-times it instead. Finds mid-off
good length on off, bunted towards mid-on for a quick single
back of a length delivery on middle and leg, easily nudged away towards fine leg to get one
ugly hoick from Dilshan. Full and straight, Dilshan sees a scoring opportunity and his instinct takes over. Looks to whack the ball through midwicket but inside-edges into this pad
fullish and wide outside off, tapped into the off side. Another tidy over from hastings
good single. Full and straight, inside-edged towards points via the pad. Dilshan responds to Chandimal's question, an easy run
full and wide outside off, bunted towards mid-on. Wanted to go over the in-field but skewed that
full on off, this one moves away slightly. Played towards point this time
too straight but a good delivery with this field. Dilshan works this towards midwicket, another dot
close. Good length on off, may have been the slower ball. Dilshan tries to steer towards third man but the ball bounces extra and takes the inside edge, just past the stumps
good end. Another tight over. Good length on off, played into the off side
yikes! Full and wide outside off, Dilshan walks across, makes it a full length and swings across the line. Misses.
good length on off, played into the leg side from the crease
good length just outside off, keeps a touch low but Dilshan plays it nicely. Watches it onto his bat
a short loopy bouncer, signalled wide. Tennis ball bounce. Dilshan thinks of pulling but withdraws, rightly so. Would have had to generate his own power
back of a length on off, Chandimal flicks towards fine leg for one
leg byes. Four of them. Back of a length on off, slower ball. Chandimal gets on top of the bounce but somehow misses his flick. The ball takes the pad, on its way to the third man boundary.

edged for four. or placed for four? He doesn't care. It's four to Dilshan. Slightly wider outside off, Dilshan wanted to  open the face of the bat and find a run to third man, but got a thick edge which flew through the vacant slips
played into the off side, angled bat to point
128 kph, pace off the ball. Pushed towards cover
another good length delivery just outside off, played into the off side from the back foot
quite full, quite wide outside off. Chandimal opens the face of the bat to guide one to third man
too straight and picked off. Dilshan waits for the ball to come him before deflecting it through fine leg, A fantastic dive from Starc to save the boundary
good single. Back of a length outside off, pushed towards point. Both batsmen respond and that means, more often than not, the single is easy
back of a length on middle, 134 kph. Chandimal somehow misses another flick. Gets hit in the midriff
good length on off, Hastings has been really good so far. Played into the leg side
good length outside off, Chandimal opens the face of the bat to guide towards third man for one
back of a length on off, the ball gets a bit big on him. Played towards the keeper for one
128 kph, full on middle and leg, driven towards mid-on
good length on off, blocked towards the bowler
good length on middle and leg, worked to deep square leg for a comfortable single
127 kph, good length on off, blocked
full and wide outside off, too much width. Chandimal gets on one knee and creams his drive past cover. Fifty partnership for these two
starts with some flight down leg, wayward. A bit of turn but Dilshan misses his sweep and gets struck on the pad down leg
shovelled towards midwicket, closed the bat face quite late
nice stuff. Lots of loop and flight. Driven to cover, with the spin
flatter on middle and leg, nudged to midwicket
flat, full, straight. Blocked
beautiful finish. Flight on middle, but a tad too full. Driven out to long-off, with the spin. Good option
full and straight, wicket to wicket stuff. Worked towards midwicket
nicely played. Quite full and wide outside off, driven down to long-off
strays down leg, Chandimal misses yet another nudge. Bewildering, straight stuff. Off the pad towards point
connects this time, worked away towards square leg to get one
back of a length on off, 126 kph. Kept out awkwardly
fullish and wide outside off, pushed away towards cover
tossed up on middle stump, Chandimal pushes it back
shorter and outside off, Chandimal hangs back to let it turn and punches it to long-off
pretty full, just like the first delivery, Dilshan pushes it back
pretty full on middle again, Dilshan sweeps it this time to deep midwicket
googly now outside off and Chandimal drives, he didn't pick it, and inside edge goes to the leg side
flighted and full outside off, Dilshan drives it straight to cover
back of length and angling in towards off, Chandimal works it behind square nicely for two quick runs
a delicate late cut this time as Hazlewood goes pretty wide outside off
bangs it in short just outside off and Dilshan hooks with a pivot off the back foot, to long leg for one
much tighter to Chandimal now, slightly out side off on back of length, he still has enough room to help it towards third man for one
130kph, looked much quicker as Dilshan stayed back and looked to cut off but the cross-seam delivery beat him with the bounce
errs towards the pads now and Dilshan glances it easily to fine leg to keep strike
nicely flighted outisde off with some turn, Dilshan helps it with the turn to point
flatter and shorter outside off, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover
absolutely full now outside off, Chandimal drives it down to long-off
touch shorter outside off and Dilshan finds the gap behind square with a sweep against the turn, beating square leg and short fine leg to pick the boundary
pretty wide outside off now, Dilshan chases with minimal footwork and gets an inner edge through Wade's legs

he's gone off a full toss and that's that for Dilshan's ODI career! He came down the track and chipped the low full toss to midwicker where Bailey had to jump a little to catch it over his head. A few handhakes from some of the Australian fielders, a pat from Chandimal and Dilshan immediately takes his helmet off and walks off with his arms aloft for the crowd. A standing ovation from the spectators, emotional scenes there
drives uppishly and away from the body as Hazlewood pitches it wide, was in the air for a bit before reaching third man
gets a freebie on the pads first ball, helps it along to fine leg to get off the mark
pushes the back of length ball square with sift hands and sets off for the quick single, Bailey picks the ball and has a shy at the bowler's stumps but misses. That would have been close!
well wide outside the off stump, called a wide as Mathews chases and misses
on the pads again and Mathews flicks it easily for one more
a flick from Chandimal now to send the ball from middle stump to deep square leg
much shorter outside off, he hangs back and defends the ball towards point
low and flighted full toss on off, driven back and Zampa misfields to let the ball pass through his legs. Sloppy work

loud appeal for lbw and Aleem Dar has raised the finger, it wasn't plumb, and Mathews reviews. It wasn't as flighted, pitched somewhere around leg stump, replays will confirm that, and straightened to beat Mathews' inside edge before hitting him in front of leg. Here comes ball tracking - pitches in line, straightens enough to hit him in line and is hitting the stumps. Mathews has to go, Zampa at it again
he picks the googly which turns in a long way from outisde off and he defends it to leg
presses forward this time to block it back
goes back towards the stumps and defends the striahgter delivery back to the bowler
similar looking delivery but it turns quite a bit, de Silva goes back to push it back again and gets a thickish edge into the covers
offcutter on length just outside off, de Silva blocks it with a straight bat not far from the stumps
comes in sharply from a shorter length now outside off, de Silva is beaten and takes it high on the pad
much straighter delivery outside off, easily defends it back this time
little bit wider now outside off, he hangs back and push it into the covers
short and going down leg, he pulls it well and late to try and beat fine leg but Faulkner runs hard and then dives to his left to save three. Applause from Warner and Hazlewood

put down? Hazlewood extracts another outside edge, forcing Chandimal on the back foot outside off, and Warner was at gully just for that. Not sure yet if it carried, but his body language says it was a chance. Yes, replays confirm it carried and Warner dropped it
shorter outside off, he chops it square towards cover point for one
nicely flighted outside off, pushed back to Zampa who throws ball right towards the batsman who had to take evasive action. De Silva was well inside the crease, Dar has a word with Zampa
stifled appeal from some of the plaers as de Silva takes the ball on the pad first after coming down the track to defend
that's the quicker one on the stumps and de Silva gets his bat down in time
outside off now and de Silva helps it into the covers with a push
some late movement from the wobbly seam on the leg stump line, Chandimal defends with a thick edge
140kph, quick and down the leg side for a wide
full and wide, Chandimal drives nicely with a knee down but finds cover
short now and outside off, not much room, he hops on his toes and guides it to point
too optimistic an appeal from Starc as the ball headed for a wide down the leg side is deflected off the pad before Wade catches it with a dive
140kph, good-length ball on the pads, he tries to flick but doesn't connect
a bouncer to end the over around middle and off, Chandimal drops his hands and sways out of the line
bit of dip for the flighted ball towards middle and leg, pushed down towards long-on for one
nicely bowled outside off and gets an outside edge - pitched up, draws him forward and gets an edge with the turn
he lunges forward now and pushes it more convincingly into the covers
shorter one and a googly, he rocks back and pulls it to deep square leg
pretty straight towards middle and leg, forward press and defends it to leg

nicely flicked over the top and de Silva breaks some shackles with a boundary. He danced down the track and took the ball almost on the full from leg stump, flicking it away with the wrists over midwicket in the wide gap
little back of length on the leg side and he works it off the pads to deep square leg
fullish outside off with the angle, he drives and an inner edge rolls towards the keeper
angles it away outside off again from length, jabbed into the covers by de Silva
left alone this time as it pitches well outside off and angles away further
some seam movement towards middle from leg, de Silva opens up and defends it to leg
full and wide, just inside the wide line and it's left alone
just outside off, pushed into the covers for a quick single
pretty full and wide outside off, he drives it back to Zampa with minimal footwork
gets a single this time with a drive down the ground to long-off
slashes at this one outside off, doesn't get the middle and finds cover
bit too full and it's helped down to long-off for an easy single
quicker one towards the leg stump, that's good work from de Silva as he works it towrds square leg and they come back for the second. Makes it five from the over
pretty slow and just back of length on the leg side, he tries to work it to leg but misjudges the pace
well outside off now with the angle, he helps it to third man easily
just short of midwicket! Fullish on middle and off, de Silva nearly chipped it half-heartedly to midwicket
gets a fuller delivery now and works it to third man for one
nicely punched down the ground from outside off, to long-off for one
on a good length outside off, de Silva waits and cuts straight to point
nice, delicate work Chandimal to hang back and guide the short ball late and fine on the off side by opening the face of the bat late. Beats third man and that's his half-century

direct hit and de Silva was miles away! Chandimal took off quickly after defending the ball towards point, Bailey was on it quickly and threw it to the keeper's end but just missed, luckily for de Silva
outside the off stump and he pushes it to sweeper cover for one
inside edge, almost onto the stumps. He tried to drive the cutter from Hastings and got an edge, which hit his pads
cracking late and square drive from Chandimal, but he finds point
easily works the ball from outside off to third man for a single
hops on his toes and works the ball off the pads towards deep backward for two quick runs
an authoritative drive through the covers as he gets to open his arms
pretty straight and towards the off stump, de Silva defends with a straight bat

he tries to accelerate and hands a catch to mid-on, good work there by Shaun Marsh! Came down the track and took the ball on the full, stroking the ball in the air and Marsh dived to his left after a few steps to grab it with both hands
bit of room outside off and he chops the ball to point
bit shorter and closer to the off stump, Kusal pushes it into the covers now
back of length outside off, he goes back and across and works it behind square on leg for two
offcutter coming in towards Chandimal from outside off, no room eventually and he helps the ball to point
punchy drive from outside off to cover this time
goes across a bit and uses his wrists to work the ball to midwicket
delicate work now as he stays back and guides the slightly slower delivery to third man
offers the straight bat for the good length ball around off stump
full and wide, a thick outside edge skews down to third man
back of a length outside off, pace off the ball. Bunted to cover. No pace in this surface
slogged past midwicket for four. Not in control at all. Full and straight, Kusal sees an opportunity and swings across the line. Uppish but just wide of midwicket
thick inside edge this time, just past the stumps for a run down to fine leg. Some inward movement
sloppy, very unlike Australia. Full and wide outside off, a nice drive to cover. Finch gets down but the ball hist his knee and ricochets for an extra
full and straight, solidly behind the line this time
full and straight, bringing this ball back in. Chandi gets behind the line and blocks.
129 kph, stays leg side of the ball. Full on off, an attractive drive to mid-off. Sees Warner fielding and refuses the run
fullish on off, bat close to pad and pushed to cover. Vital deliveries ticking away, a single or two releases pressure.
better. Good length on off, comes back in. Steered to third man
lovely lines these, nagging away on and around off. Kusal blocks
superb over from Hazlewood. Accurate on off again, and Kusal blocks to cover
a low full toss on off, Chandimal pushes towards mid-off and calls for one. Easily made
lovely change-up. Bouncer on middle and Kusal gets underneath
there it is. The inswinging yorker on middle, Kusal hurriedly keeps it out
full and wide, slashed to backward point. That was hit hard, Bailey gets a hand on it to save four.
full and straight, bunted down to long-on
short and wide outside off, Chandimal gets on top of the bounce and slaps to cover. Signs of a slow surface
short and slow on off, Kusal waits and waits before pulling to deep square leg
overpitched on middle, squeezed to Bailey at midwicket
flight outside off, Chandimal looks to hit that too hard, inside-edges towards square leg for one
the googly! Spins from leg to off, Kusal picks it off the pitch and bunts it back
two in a row. Short and wide outside off, another googly. Slapped to deep cover for a brace
more flight on off, Kusal runs down and hammers his drive back at Zampa, who gets a hand on it.
low full toss, looking for the yorker. Nicely flicked towards backward square leg, who gets around and prevents the second.
wayward down the leg side, 141 kph. Mis-directed. A free run
full and straight, 144 kph. Chandimal flicks and finds midwicket.
nicely played. Short outside off, 142 kph. Chandimal arches his back and cuts to third man
slower ball, pace off the ball. Straight, turned to midwicket

too good! Another swinging yorker does for Kusal. Tailed in on leg, Kusal misses his flick and the ball hits leg stump. Some discernible late movement back in. May have ricocheted off the pads, and then into the stumps
full and straight, moving back in. Perera misses his flick and is struck on the pads down leg
cross-seam, slower ball on off, pushed towards mid-off
fullish outside off, skews off the outside half towards cover for one
nice drive. Back of a length outside off, moves away. Pushed to deep cover for a run
short and wide outside off, cut down to third man
short, loopy bouncer on middle. Pulled down towards fine leg. Too high to control
back of a length on off, tapped towards point. Perera sends his partner back
back of a length outside off, 134 kph. Slashed to point
back of a length on middle, pulled to deep midwicket for a couple. Got on top of the bounce nicely there
good length on off, worked towards backward square leg this time and Perera comes back for two more. Well played
back of a length outside off, bunted out to cover from the back foot. No run
just over midwicket for a couple more. Full and straight, Perera drove but the ball skewed off the inside half, got just enough power to clear midwicket
shortish and wide outside off, carved out to deep point for one

taken! What was that from Perera. Pace off the ball from Hastings, Perera went through with his wild hoick and only succeeded in slogging it into the hands of deep square leg. Lovely bowling, wily change in pace.
good length on off and middle, solidly behind the line
slogged across the line. Pace off the ball again, back of a length outside off. Chandi is through his stroke
back of a length on off, Chandi gets on top of the bounce and pulls to fine leg
back of a length outside off, pushed to deep cover from the crease
better, fullish length outside off, punched out towards deep cover for a run.
too straight from Hazlewood, gets picked off by Chandi who uses his wrists to get it behind square. Nicely played.
back of a length outside off, patted towards backward point. Bailey is quick on it, bad single. A direct hit would have had the batsman
back of a length on off, Prasanna rides the bounce and pulls to deep square leg
well bowled, full and straight, Chandimal is squared up but gets one to deep cover
beauty. Good length outside off, Prasanna fishes at that but the ball goes past
good length on middle, solidly behind the line is Prasanna
nice stuff. Flight on off, a bit of loop and drift. Chandimal defends
shortish and wide outside off, Chandimal gets on top of the bounce and slaps his cut to deep point
flat outside off, extracts some spin. Worked away towards midwicket from the back foot
flight outside off, drilled to long-off
how did that miss? The slider just outside off, Prasanna plays back and his off stump is almost pegged back

picks out deep midwicket. Filthy half-tracker on off, Prasanna rocks back and nails his pull, but straight to Bailey who sets himself under and takes it. Not the way Zampa would have wanted to get  that
yorker on off, patted towards point
full on off, some late away movement. Driven to cover
another low full toss on middle, driven straight to cover who fires the throw at the non-strikers end. Ricochets off towards square leg for a free run. Finch raises his hand in apology
yorker, but wide outside off. Jammed out to point
strays down leg this time, a free run. Wide
beauty. How do you play that? Full on off, so Perera lays the line, but the ball jags away so late. Beats the bat. Superb bowling
solidly behind the line of that, angled his bat to find the gap through cover
flight outside off, nice drift. Driven to deep cover
flatter and wide outside off, tapped out towards cover
drifts down leg, slides on. Raps Perera on the pad down leg. An optimistic appeal is quickly struck down
the googly this time, flight outside off, defended

bat says umpire Aleem Dar. That looked close. Warner opts to review. No bat. A flat delivery on leg, the ball skids on and strikes Perera on the front pad, then back pad. So two pads. Phew, that was close. Umpire's call on impact, I don't think that was what the umpire called but that is the decision, i presume. He didn't give the lbw because he thought there was bat.
flight on off, driven back to the bowler
looking for that yorker again, pushed out to deep cover from the crease
lovely bowling, full and straight, pushed to long-off. Very late movement
full and wide outside off, the ball beats the bat after some late movement
and again. Full on off, Perera plays the line but the ball goes past. Can't do much but just that.
full on off, solidly behind the line to block
full and straight from Starc, Perera somehow keeps it out
nicely played. Full and wide outside off, dragged from well outside off to square leg for a couple. A wayward throw from Wade to the non-strikers end, but no damage
slower ball, pace off. Chandimal gets across and fails to connect with his flick
played fine for a couple. straight, another slower ball. Chandimal gets right across the line to turn
fullish and straight again, Chandimal misses his flick. May have struck him just outside the lune
and again, not sure if this is clever. Fuller than a good length just outside off, Chandimal tries to flick through square leg but misses
and again, walks across to try and get one to square leg but fails to
full and wide, too wide in fact as Chandimal slashes this down to third man for a brace
full outside off, pushed into the covers for one
overpitched outside off, driven towards cover. SL going nowhere
good length outside off, carved straight to point. Another dot
bouncer on off, the slower bouncer. Perera gets on top of the bounce to slap towards midwicket for a quick run
another bouncer, this one just too high. A wide, way over the batsman's head
walks across and clips this 119 kph full delivery to fine leg for one
fullish and wide outside off, Faulkner shuffles across but flicks into his pad.
drifts down leg, a  wide, another extra. Australia already six minutes past the scheduled end-of-innings time
Warner cannot believe he has missed. Fullish ioutside off, the slower ball. Perera bunts his stroke to cover where Warner sets himself but misses
another wide, way outside the tramline
another slower delivery outside off, pushed to long-on
another missed throw. Driven towards cover point, Marsh picks up and fires over the stumps as Perera was sent back
four more. Fullish and wide outside off, a thick inside edge misses the stumps and whistles to the fine leg fence. Vital runs
slower delivery outside off, steered towards third man where Hastings is slow to it and returns a loopy throw, allowing the batsmen to ease back for the second
just past Wade. A short, slow bouncer on off, Chandimal gets low and looks to ramp it to fine leg but gets it on the glove. Wade scurries back but just cannot get there
short, slow, wide delivery. Chandimal walks way across the line to try and ramp to fine leg, misses and the umpire rightly doesn't call a wide
shortish on middle, gets on top of the bounce and plays it down to fine leg
whew, way over mid-off. Dilruwan backs away, gets a length delivery and goes after his lofted slap. Enough power behind that to carry the distance
gone this time. A short delivery on off, bouncer. Dilruwan stays in his crease and checks his pull straight to Warner at midwicket. Didn't keep it down, didn't go after it. Lobbed a catch instead
full yorker outside off, 128 kph. Jammed out
four more. Chandimal moves onto 98. Full toss outside off, Chandimal goes after it but the ball moves away in the air. A thick outside edge races away to the third man boundary
full and wide outside off, Chandimal shuffles across, looks to guide one to third man but misses
just the one. Full and wide outside off, Chandimal looks to drive but the ball skews to third man for one. Chandimal on 99, but Aponso on strike
well played. Raucous cheers for that run. Fullish outside off, pushed away to cover
yorker on off, Chandimal looks to flick through midwicket but can only find the bowler

that's Chandimal's 100. What an innings this has been. Takes off his helmet, kisses the badge and soaks in the applause for this has been a special effort with wickets falling all around him. Drove a full delivery to deep cover to also keep strike
low full toss on off, Chandimal gets low and looks to sweep but doesn't make contact. Hit on the pads, just outside the line of off. Bat says the umpire, but no bat.

nice catch from Zampa at long-on to end the innings. A slower ball on off, Chandimal comes down and swings through the line, the ball goes up, stays up for quite a while, but Zampa sets himself under it at long-on and takes a good catch.
almost a yorker swinging into Warner who loses a bit of balance while pushing the ball down to mid-on
outside off now and Warner punches it down to mid-on
thick outside edge as Warner sticks his bat out for the delivery angling away. Gets a single to third man
tentative start as Finch inside-edges a length ball onto his pads
some away swing for Mathews outside off, Finch drives it gently into the covers
angles it in this time, pretty full too, and Finch on-drives. Midwicket dives to his left to get a hand and they sneak in a single
another inside edge for Finch - tries to drive into the covers but gets the edge towards long leg and comes back for the second quickly
that's a back-foot punch Finch has middled and he made it look effortless! Back of length outside off and he had enough room to rock on the back foot and guide it past cover point
much fuller now from Thisara and it's driven straight to cover
more towards middle and leg now, Finch pushes it down towards long-on with a straight bat
gets the line wrong with a wide down the leg side
still outside the leg stump and Warner helps it towards midwicket for one
straight delivery and Finch drives it absolutely straight back down the ground for one to long-on to keep strike
angles the ball sharply into Finch towards middle stump, he works it to midwicket by closing the face of the bat
gets some room outside off and Warner slashes it down to mid-off
it comes into him again and Finch works it to the midwicket region for one more
just a bit of room outside off, back of length delivery and Warner punches it into the covers for one
solid defence down the ground for a length delivery, single to mid-on
pretty tight around the off stump now, Warner defends it back
there's no long-off and Finch makes use of that, six on the first ball! He makes room, gets a flighted delivery on middle stump and lofts it straight down over long-off for six
makes room again, cuts this shorter delivery towards cover
outside off and this one comes in with the angle, Finch cuts with a bottom edge to cover point for a quick single
nice turn to Warner from off stump, he waited for it and got a bit of bat to get a single to short fine leg
what a beauty! Looped it towards middle stump with flight, drawing Finch forward, and as the bat came forward, the ball turned and bounced past the outside edge and the stumps
lbw appeal from Kusal but the straighter delivery had some inside edge before taking the pad
just back of length on leg, steered to midwicket and the fielder dives to keep it to one
he's bowling a bit too much towards middle and leg to Finch who is easily putting them away to wards deep square leg. One more
punched through extra cover for a four! Bit too short and the angle helps Warner get some more room by the time the ball reaches him and he crunches it past a diving extra cover
tighter line and length - more towards off stump and Warner defends it into the off side

yes, it's him! Dilshan takes a superb diving catch at point and yes, it's Warner who has to go! Looked like a bit of extra bounce outside off as Warner checked his jab but did it with hard hands, the bounce takes a good meat of the bat to fly towards point where Dilshan dives low to his left to get both his hands under the ball
length delivery on the off stump, no room, and Marsh pushes it down to mid-off
that one was headed for the off stump, so no room, but Finch has made some on his own and the ball is sliding in, but he punches it off the back foot and through the covers for four
presses forward this time to block the ball outside off
much slower through the air, around off, Finch covers his stumps and defends
bowls outside leg, Finch tries a big sweep and misses, goes through the keeper's legs but de Silva anticipates to run towards leg slip and stops it
bit too short and wide, powerful cut off the back foot but he finds point
pretty full outside off now and it's driven down to long-off for one
pretty tight outside off, Finch defends it solidly towards mid-on
some room, Finch cuts it right off the middle and the crowd roars as Dilshan dives to his right and saves four!
not as much room but enough to work it down to long-off for one
slightly slower at 110kph outside off, Marsh defends it on the off side
beaten outside off! Some more room but it was the angle that made Marsh chase the delivery outside off, and he poked and missed
now the tight off-stump line and Marsh defends with a straight bat
some flight on the off stump, defended off the front foot
he's picked the gap with a sweep and he laps it from just outside off to the deep backward boundary for four!

big big appeal from Aponso, Aleem Dar raises the finger, Finch has a short chat and walks off without reviewing it. This was looped towards the stumps and Finch tried to defend by covering them all, maybe he played for the turn but the ball angled in and trapped him right in front. Was it headed a bit too much towards leg though?
pretty full on off, pushed back to the bowler
similar delivery with the flight, Bailey pushes it back again
comes down the track this time and takes it on the pad outside leg
hardly any room outside off, driven to cover point
much fuller around the off stump, pushed down to mid-off now

there's an appeal for run out at the keeper's end and Aleem Dar in action again, he signals for the third umpire. Marsh clipped the ball down to mi-on and set off, Bailey responded too and dragged his bat in the way batsmen should to save himself as there was a direct hit
angling in a bit, worked down to mid-on for a quick single

chipped in the air, taken at mid-off! But is it clean? Shaun Marsh wants to hang around as the third umpire is called in and the soft signal is out. It was a fullish delivery outside off, Marsh chipped it half-heartedly down to mid-off where Chandimal dives forward and takes it. A lot of replays being shown for the third umpire, looks like he has got his fingers just under the ball, it's not 100% clear but I think it's out. And the crowd roars as the umpire raises his finger!
the slower delivery is pretty full outside off, and Head pushes it gently down to mid-off
some flight for the length delivery outside off, pushed into the covers
tossed up outside off now, he drives with the turn but it angles in and takes the inside edge to leg
comes down the track this time and drives to long-off for one
fullish on the off stump, he pushes it back
bit of a forward lean and he defends it back
extra bounce this time as Head goes back to play it after the turn but is suprised a bit as it comes up a bit too close to say hello to him
not pulled from the middle of the bat, Bailey takes a couple as the ball lands well wide of midwicket
cuts this ball in from outside off, Bailey stays back and defends
more towards middle and leg now, he pushes it down to mid-on
absolutely straight down the ground and it's caressed back right along the ground with a straight bat from Bailey, just missing the non-striker's stumps to go for four
the slightly slow offcutter from outside off, Bailey waits and defends
hops on his toes and clips the ball nicely to the leg side wide of deep midwicket for two
edged past first slip for four! Head was drawn forward with that length and the ball didn't turn in enouigh, taking the outside edge. The ball wasn't too far from first slip
fuller on off, pushed back to the bowler
straighter delivery outside off, quicker too, he defends it back again
presses forward this time and blocks it ner the pitch
comes down towards the pitch of the ball on off and drives it down to mid-off
straight on the middle stump and Bailey sweeps it a bit dangerously behind square
defends it back solidly to the bowler with a stright bat
comes down the track, takes it on the full and drives it on the on side against the turn and sends it straight enough to beat mid-on
he almost withdrew his bat as the ball turned away a bit but got some bat towards slip
bit too full outside off and it's driven firmly through the covers
pretty quick through the air outside off, Head blocks
on the pads and easily clipped away for one
pretty flat outside off, Head defends it back
rocks back this time as he sees room and crunches that to sweeper cover for one
flat and on length on leg, Bailey helps it to midwicket
slightly slower on leg stump, works it behind square with soft hands so that he can come back for the second but there's not enough time
Head uses his feet to come down and take the ball on the full, drives it back firmly but it's can't beat a diving Dilshan
nice loop outside off, Bailey leans forward and blocks
down the leg side this time and he sweeps it pretty fine to get two
turning in a bit from off to middle, presses forward to push it back
that's on middle and leg and turning but Bailey reverse-sweeps it so well in the gap that he's picked four! Sent along the ground through extra cover of a RHB
pretty full on middle and leg, driven back towards mid-on
turning into the batsman, bat-pad and the ball lobs up but short leg was taken off few deliveries ago
takes a couple of steps down and pushes firmly into the off side
a forward lean and Head defends it back
excellent footwork as Head comes down to make it a half-volley and he drives it firmly and straight just past Dilshan for a four!
in the air and wide of backward point for four! Shortish and turning away, Head stayed back and cut it away in the air, wide of the fielder in the gap
drives this one firmly with a straight bat to long-off
slightly straighter and slower, Bailey goes back and defends the ball to leg
bit of flight on off and Head punches it back
fullish again on off and Head pushes it back again
comes down, Perera pitches it towards leg, Head tries to drive to leg but takes it on the pad
sweetly timed and driven through the covers with the turn for one
the slider that angles past Bailey after pitching on off, he was drawn forward to defend but the ball beat him
much fuller now, on off, he defends it back
offers some room outside off, Head rocks back and cuts it to sweeper cover for one
leans forward and pushes the ball towards midwicket for a quick single
length delivery on off, no turn and Head blocks it back
Head uses his feet now and comes down to block the ball back on the full
more towards the pads now and he helps it to midwicket for one
the straighter one from off stump, leading edge was in the air for a bit before it landed in the covers. Dilshan has his arms up in excitement but no success
nice drift outside off, flat. Pushed to point, hurried Head for pace
86 kph, quick through the air, flat and full. Head brings out nimble footwork to drive to deep cover
lovely shot. Brings out the reverse sweep and nails it, finds deep backward point
flat, fired in on off. Head goes back and punches  back to the bowler
air, lots of it, outside off. head closes his bat face too early and gets a leading edge towards cover
flat again on off, Bailey goes right back to play it back to the bowler
quick but strays down leg, swept away towards fine leg. Nice pace but wrong line
lovely stuff, loop and on a fun length. Brings Bailey forward who keeps it out
too much width outside off, slapped to deep cover
nice, full and flat on middle, thick inside edge towards square leg for a run
flight outside off, drilled to long-off
nice pace, slow through the air. Head comes down and nurdles towards fine leg for a quick single
poor start. Short and wide outside off, slapped to deep cover
nicely played. Back of a length on off, Bailey gets on top of the bounce and deflects to third man
lovely shot. Picked the length early and then nailed his pull to midwicket for four. Sat up for Head to dispatch with an exquisitely-timed pull
slow and wide outside off, too wide and called
fullish on off, decent line but a tad too full. Hit out to cover
overpitched again, drilled to long-on
full again and quite close to off stump, bailey shows it the respect it deserves and blocks
ooh, great work from slip. Flat down leg, Head misses his sweep. So does the keeper after some vicious spin, but DdS gets around and prevents more wides
nudged to midwicket
gets to the pitch and works the ball to deep midwicket. Played that well
tossed up on off, driven to cover with the spin, nice
81 ks, slow through the air outside off, pushed out to cover, but opened the face late to find the gap
comes down, smothers the spin and works to midwicket
too full, 78 ks, down leg too, nudged down to fine leg
flatter trajectory outside off, slashed towards cover who prevents the run with a  dive

bowled this time. A wrong shot. And he will not be happy with that. Slides on with the arm from outside off, comes back in and Head goes back to cut. A cry of anguish as missed that. Big wicket. Picked the wrong delivery to go back to.
Wade gets across right away and paddle sweeps to fine leg for one. Clever shot. Got outside the line
ah, a freebie. Flat down leg, Bailey helps himself to one with a sweep
well bowled. Slow through the air outside off, Wade comes forward and plonks a defensive block
flat on middle, blocked
tossed up outside off, bailey gives himself some room and hits his drive to cover
flatter and wide outside off, a thick inside edge towards midwicket. Mathews scurries across to stop the ball and then fires an accurate throw to the non-strikers end, but Bailey is fine.
flight outside off, drilled to long-off. Full face of the bat
nice loop and flight on middle, blocked
overpitched on leg, drilled to long-off
overpitched on off, hammered down to long-on for an easy single. Played that nicely
just short of cover. Flight outside off, draws Wade forward who bunts his drive towards cover.
gets down and sweeps this one towards fine leg
flat on leg, Bailey chips his flick to midwicket
flat on middle, Bailey blocks
too straight, worked away to fine leg
nice flight on leg, driven to the bowler.
a full toss to start from Aponso, Bailey shapes for a reverse sweep and creams it. Placed beautifully behind point and gets four. Nice shot selection, great execution
flight on off, blocked
loads of flight outside off, scythed to deep cover
Wade gets across, gets low and gets one with a deft paddle sweep to fine leg
uses the feet, comes to the pitch and drives to long-on
another fine paddle sweep to fine leg gets Wade one more. These two ticking along nicely
uses his feet, runs to the pitch and drives back to the bowler
almost the same length that did for Head, but Wade went back and played with a straight bat to cover.
short and wide, enough width for Wade to scythe to deep point
another reverse sweep. Lots of bat on his stroke to deep point to get one
superb shot. Uses his feet this time, gets to the pitch and creams his flick through midwicket. Made a stroke against the spin look so easy
chips this towards cover for a couple. Really clever batting from Wade
flat again, slides on. Bailey comes forward and inside edges his push to square leg

massive appeal, and Mathews opts to review. Flatm but full delivery on off. Wade gets down and looks to sweep, but misses it because of the length. The ball goes on and hits Wade in front of off. Is enough of that ball hitting off stump? Massive moment in the game. Clearly no bat. An explosion as the bat made contact with the pitch. Hawkeye shows the ball sliding on to miss off stump. So a good call from Aleem Dar.
Wade gets low and connects with another fine paddle to fine leg
nice, slow through the air on middle. Blocked by Bailey
runs to the pitch and drives to long-off
goes across and sweeps to fine leg but a fielder has been brought up to prevent that run
drifts down leg, played towards square leg
good fielding. Bailey reverse laps towards third man who gets across and prevents the ball from going through
too short on leg, pulled to square leg. Exceptional running as Bailey comes back for the second
nudged into the leg side
lots of air down leg, Bailey gets down to reverse sweep but misses as the ball hits him on the thigh
slow through the air outside off, played away into the off side
another reverse sweep, he'll get four for it. Made some room and then helped it along, fine, past third man. Superb
down leg to prevent that reverse sweep so Bailey employs the sweep, to fine leg
yikes, an ugly hoick but there was a gap there. Comes down and smears his slog through midwicket
short and wide outside off, plenty of width and slashed to deep point
another fine paddle sweep towards fine leg
worked into the leg side for one more, another productive over for Australia
a big appeal, Bailey looks to sweep but the ball skids on to beat that stroke. Pitched well outside leg
flat down leg, nudged to deep midwicket
short on middle, worked away through square leg. Saw a gap and exploited it, nice
flatter and wide outside off, scythed to deep point
too easy. Flight down leg, calmly worked away towards midwicket
tossed up, driven on the up, to cover
short and wide, too much width and Bailey takes Australia one closer with a slapped punch through cover
a slower delivery on off, comes back in ever so slightly, just enough to take the inside edge towards fine leg
good length on off, bunted out towards mid-on
good length outside off, nice channels too. Pushed out towards point
nope, too much width this time. Short and wide outside off, Bailey gets on to pof the bounce and laces his cut past point. Played that late to find the gap, fifty too, quality knock
fullish length on off, blocked
a filthy half-tracker outside off, Wade goes right back and slaps it in front of cover. Four easy runs
tossed up, flight on off, Wade opens up his stance and drives to long-off
flight outside off, Bailey runs down and clips to long-on, another nice stroke
nicely tossed up on off, driven back towards the bowler
flat on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on, against the spin for one
a neat nudge to fine leg for more runs. Off the pad in fact for a couple more

oh beauty. Superb flight, dip and turn. Draws Bailey forward with the flight. And the turn helps the ball spin past Bailey's outside edge. Bailey outdone by a beauty, but ensures he doesn't lift his foot as Kusal was swift in removing the bails
tossed up on off, pushed away towards cover
loads of air outside off, smeared towards cover

all happening. The umpire says no, but the leg umpire isn't so sure, he calls for the third umpire. Flat down leg, Bailey missed his reverse sweep. Struck him on the pad. Went out wandering, Kusal was aware, picked up the ball and threw the stumps down but Bailey was back
vicious turn. Tossed up outside off, Bailey leaves
Wade tries to execute another paddle sweep but missed. Enured he got outside the line
misses leg stump by not a lot. Flat on middle, Wade gets down and may have got something. Goes through Kusal's legs too.
shortish and wide outside off, Wade slices his cut to deep backward point. Bailey rushes back for three, lovely running
flat on leg, played away towards square leg
yet another reverse sweep to deep point
another fine paddle sweep to fine leg for one. Nine easy runs for Australia
good amount of turn from middle and leg to the leg side, will be a wide though
better line this time - right outside off stump and Wade blocks with a forward lean

there comes the Wade sweep and there comes a direct hit from deep backward square leg, it's gone to the third umpire! Wade swept the ball hard and Gunathilaka did very well to throw the ball flat and hit the stumps, but Wade made it in
covers his off stump and then blocks the fuller ball on the off side

some appeals there, for lbw, for stumping, and they're checking for a stumping now. Wade swept, Wade missed, Wade looked back and saw the bails being dislodged. Kusal collected the ball alright but didn't take the bails off on first attempt, when Wade was probably outside the cresae. When he tried again, Wade's toe seems to have come back a little
slightly slower on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
flicks the ball to deep midwicket with the turn off the front foot
pitched outside off, maybe turning away too, but Wade sweeps it behind square
on Bailey's leg stump now, he unleashes the sweep too and gets two
flat and quick on the leg stump, Bailey goes back and tucks the ball to square leg
well outside leg now but Bailey reverse sweeps it to deep point now, one more
beaten just around off! Nicely bowled - turn and bounce as Wade went back to push it into the covers but missed the line
comes forward this time and drives into the covers
beautifully bowled outside off to draw Bailey forward - nice grip, turn and he beats the outside edge
much fuller now because Bailey came down the track and drove to long-off
turns it sharply into Wade who goes back to cut but has to adjust to just help it to point
presses forward to negate the turn and steers the ball towards deep point
if you bowl to Wade on the pads, he'll sweep it away and he shows it how; gets a single
straight and quick on middle, tucked towards midwicket and Prasanna chases it to dive and stop it

another stumping appeal and this time the finger has gone up, third umpire not required! Wade tried the sweep yet again but did not connect at all, by the time the ball reached Kusal, Wade was well outside the crease, almost losing balance, with the stretch and Kusal whipped the bails off by the time Wade could drag it back
pretty flat down the leg side for a wide
some mix-up there between the batsmen as Faulkner defends into the covers, comes out for a single with hesitation, is then sent back by Bailey and the cover fielder gets a direct hit
more towards the pads now and Faulkner clips it to deep midwicket for one
leg-stump line but no room to hit the ball, pushed back to the bowler
drawn forward, Bailey defends and gets some bat-pad, it falls just wide of short leg!
out comes the reverse sweep, Bailey doesn't middle it and the keeper and bowler appeal for lbw but it's given as runs
tossed up outside off, too full and Bailey drives that firmly but straight to cover
comes down to take it on the full and pushes the ball to long-on
too full again outside off, driven to cover
some turn from off-stump line, better length, Faulkner defends on off
fullish again and it's driven down easily to long-off

beaten fair and square! It's that beauty of a legspinner that pitches on length on off, draws the batsman forward and when he defends, the ball changes direction and goes past the outside edge to fool him
pushes the fullish delivery back to the bowler from off stump
better lenght on off stump, blocked off the front foot now
slightly shorter and now Faulkner goes back to defend the slider
slides it way too much and this one's gone fine down the leg side, off the front pad for leg byes

on middle stump on length, Bailey has his reverse sweep out and almost finds the gap behind square on the off side. Prasanna, in the deep, runs a long way and dives full length to his left to save two
takes a couple of steps down and pushes the ball to long-off
outside off and turning away too, Bailey laps it to leg with a sweep
he pitches it shorter and Bailey rocks on the back foot to punch the ball to deep point
puts his front foot forward and works the ball to cover point for a quick single
too full around off, driven with the turn straight to cover
pretty flat with minimal turn on off, punched to sweeper cover for two more

it's gone through, Bailey is bowled! The conventional legspinning delivery with some revs on it, it was flighted on leg sutmp and Bailey leaned forward to defend for the turn, bat in front of middle, but it didn't turn and deflected off the front pad to the stumps instead
that turn from Aponso squared up Faulkner a bit, he didn't play for enough turn and the leading edge went o point for a quick single
flighted on the off stump, struck down firmly to long-on
pitches it shorter on off, he waits for the turn and then helps it to point

oh my, Faulkner has holed out to deep square leg, the crowd comes alive! Where have these people come from? Unnecessary shot from Faulkner, sweeping the length ball against the turn to the leg side and Dilruwan only had to go a bit to his left to take that comfortably, well inside the boundary
excitement all around as Starc flicks, gets an inside edge onto his front pad and that lands just wide of a diving short leg
too full now and Starc flicks that firmly and straight to midwicket
pretty full just outside off, he digs it out to long-on for one
Starc covers the stumps to defend but the ball turns sharply into him, hitting the pads
there's long-on, but Starc doesn't care! He goes down on a knee and slogs the fullish delivery from well outside off, straight over long-on's head for a clean six!
not a bit short outside off, Starc goes back to punch it through cover
covers the stumps and defends the ball on middle and leg
drifts the ball towards leg, dipping it almost into the block hole, Hastings digs it out to long-on
on leg stump on length and he drives the ball back
outside off now, Hastings punches the ball down to long-off for one
length delivery just outside off, easily pushed down to long-off for one
chipped in the air, just wide of midwicket! Pitched up a little, Hastings clipped it with the turn to leg and in the air, but safely
Starc goes after it again, targets the long-on boundary and the ball lands well short of long-on and then bounces over his head for four!

gone this time, straight to long-on, yes you read that right! One shot after another Starc has been hitting to long-on, and this time he connects well to hand it to Prasanna who had to go a bit to his right. Good catch in the end
he was almost bowled there, the way Smith was bowled by Herath in the Tests while trying to cut off the back foot. But Zampa connects just in time, and, on top of that, gets four behind square
doesn't go back that much now and helps the ball to point
much fuller now and Zampa pushes it to cover more convincingly
fullish again, pushed into the covers again and a dive means no time for a run
a bit of "no, yes, no" as the ball goes fine on the leg side off the pad. But Hastings doesn't want a run

in the air, Dilruwan gets his right hand to it with a jump, but can't hold on, Australia win by two wickets! Zampa slashed at the ball when he saw room and the ball was sailing over extra cover where Dilruwan jumped, got his right hand to it, then tried again while fallin down but the ball avoided him completely
